reviews.text:
This is a fairly basic railway station, which allows passengers to take train journeys either towards Huddersfield, or towards Leeds in the opposite direction.

It's seen as basic because, there is no car parking facility, there is no bike rack, and there is no electronic signage to indicate when trains might be arriving. Also, there are no staff on site, and there is no way that any passenger can buy a ticket here.

What does it have? It has two platforms, and on each platform there is a passenger shelter (with some basic seating in it), and that's about it. Because there is no electronic signage, passengers have to rely upon a tannoy System indicating whether trains will be stopping (or whether passengers should stand well back from the platforms as fast trains rush on past the railway station platforms).
